intro: Schrebera macrocarpa, commonly known as the giant schrebera, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant produces woody capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Schrebera macrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
